OptionPackage.DisplayName: G130, G150, S120, S150, SINAMICS MV, S210

Comment.MultiLanguageText: Inhibit motor (disable output stage, uncontolled stop)
Ramp send in miliseconds (range : 100-10000ms, if 0 then default 1s will be used)
Process data is enabled (1 = Drive can be controlled via fieldbus)
Inverter power section is ready for operation
Process data is enabled (1 = Drive can be controlled via fieldbus)
Rapid stop with stop ramp t13/t23, brake applied after stop
Stop to drive at normal ramp

AttributeList.Text:
============================================================================ This module is the interface to a SEW drive MDX using 3 PD ============================================================================
SEW drive config:
- 8.. Unit functions l - 87 Process data assignment
_____________________ 870 Setpoint description PO1 l Control word 2 v l _____________________ 871 Setpoint description PO2 l Setpoint speed [%] v l _____________________ 872 Setpoint description PO3 l Ramp v l _____________________ 873 Actual value description PI1 l Status word 1 v l _____________________ 874 Actual value description PI2 l Actual speed v l _____________________ 875 Actual value description PI3 l Output current v l _____________________ 876 PO data enable l Yes v l l v This changes to no when a POx paramater is changed Dot not forget to put this back to yes !

Comment.MultiLanguageText: Copy data with HW ID _________ /________ / l input telegram l SEW l l ===============>> PLC l Drive _l / -l__l

AttributeList.Text: Copies the Input telegram to a local varibale struct
**** 1 - Inputs **** Read input telegram and store in struct
**** 4.6 - Machine Status - Indication **** Animation status word
**** 4.6 - Machine Status - Indication **** Animation control word

When the fault input is "True" then the status code send over the byte is a fault code as decimal. When the fault input is "False" then the status code send over the byte is a warning / status code as decimal.
**** 4.6 - Machine Status - Calculated **** Status / Warning / Fault code from drive
Drive ready state and process data from PLC is active (Drive is listening to PLC)
**** 4.6 - Machine Status - Calculated **** Ouput stage enabled (motor powered)
**** 5.2 - Equations - Flow Equations **** Control inhibit (disable output stage, uncontolled stop)
**** 5.2 - Equations - Flow Equations **** OFF1 (normal start / stop)

Comment.MultiLanguageText:
^ Speed (%) Stop signal at 5s l / 100% l______________/_ l \ \ l \ \ l \ \ l \ \ 0% l___________________\_____\___________________________> Time (s) l OFF2 OFF1 (regular start stop) 7s 10s
Ramp down time settings to be done in the drive.
OFF2 is to be used for controlled stops when there is a need to stop faster then regular, for example when there is an E-stop at a lift it is better to do a conttrolled stop and after that (x time in safety program) to give a STO.
Note if there is a safe stop availible on safety level this is to be used instead of the non safety signals. _

AttributeList.Text:
Setpoint to drive is given in 0 to 4000Hex = 0 to 100% of maximum speed / 0 to -4000Hex = 0 to -100% of maximum speed.
maximum speed is not the same as motor reference speed!
4000Hex = 16384 dec.
Ramp send in miliseconds (range : 100-10000ms, if 0 then default 1s will be used)

Comment.MultiLanguageText:
Motor Current in % compared to the drive reference current (not the motor reference current)
Remove - sign and use absolute value.
Then scale this to the correct value (divide by 10 to get %)
(This needs to be done since the drive can only send intiger values and not real values, so the drive does the percentage x10 to give a value behind the comma.)
Then scale the % to a Ampere value and a % value compared to the motor reference current.

AttributeList.Text: Motor Current in % compared to the drive reference current (not the motor reference current)

LineComment.Text: Copy input telegram booleans to O_****** parameters for use outside this block.

Comment.MultiLanguageText: Copy data with HW ID _________ output telegram /________ / l PLC ===============>> l SEW l l l Drive _l / -l__l

AttributeList.Text: **** 8 - Outputs **** Write output telegram with data in struct
